results.title: Hammers over the anvil
results.creator_credit: Ann Turner, Ben Gannon, South Australian Film Corporation and Harvest Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the stories of the same title by Alan Marshall, this is the story of a young boy who suffered many hardships in life, but none so savage as contracting polio and being unable to walk without crutches. Despite his affliction, he dreams of being a great horseman like the town’s hero, East Driscoll (Russell Crowe). Handsome and skilful, East is the most popular man in town, but as the boy discovers one summer, heroes can fall, and when East begins a passionate affair with an older woman, he comes face to face with a hard and cruel society with strict social taboos and even harsher penalties. It was a summer that would ultimately shape the rest of his life. NB: THIS PROGRAM IS RATED M. PARENTS SHOULD BE AWARE THAT IT IS SUITABLE FOR ADOLESCENTS ONLY.

results.title: Like water for chocolate = Como agua para chocolate
results.creator_credit: Alfonso Arau and Arau Films International
results.brief_description: Multi-award winning Mexican film which tells the story of Tita who is forbidden by tradition and a tyrannical mother to marry Pedro. Tita finds solace for her suppressed passion and sorrow in her cooking, which has a profound effect on all who partake. Based on Laura Esquivel’s best-seller, “Like water for chocolate” is an enchanting film which radiates warmth and emotional depth. It is visual feast starring Marco Leonardi, Lumi Cavazos and Regina Torne. Spanish dialogue. English subtitles.

results.title: The Magnificent seven (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Sturges, Alpha Company and Mirisch Corporation
results.brief_description: In a stroke of filmmaking inspiration, director John Sturges saw the possibility of transposing Akira Kurosawa’s film classic “The Seven Samurai”, from feudal Japan to the American West and it worked brilliantly. Yul Brynner stars as the leader of a group of skilled gunfighters hired to protect a poor Mexican village from marauding bandits led by the vicious Calvera, played with ruthless delight by Eli Wallach. Fighting alongside Brynner and Steve McQueen are Charles Bronson, James Coburn and Robert Vaughn, whose film careers were launched by this film. With a now-classic musical score and stunning cinematography, “the Magnificent Seven” provides exciting entertainment as well as touching on the themes of dignity, honour, courage and survival. The film established a new standard for future generations of Westerns.

results.title: The Secret garden (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Fred M Wilcox, Clarence Brown and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A delightful dramatisation based on the well-known children’s book of the same name. A young girl comes to live in a run down Victorian estate and finds an abandoned garden which she cares for. She befriends the young crippled son of the house - with amazing results. Starring Margaret O’Brien and Dean Stcokwell.

results.title: The Phantom of the opera
results.creator_credit: Arthur Lubin, George Waggner and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Gaston Leroux’s classic horror tale stars Claude Rains as the immortal phantom who haunts the Paris Opera. As a crazed composer, he is haunted by the beautiful soprano of the company, (Susanna Foster), and is determined to revenge himself upon those who have stolen his music. Nelson Eddy plays the heroic young baritone who tracks down the disfigured madman who has begun to murder those who resist his demands. The lavish colour production moves to a terrifying climax as the phantom is chased through the catacombs of Paris.

results.title: Forbidden planet
results.creator_credit: Fred Wilcox, Nicholas Nayfack and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The year is 2257AD and the distant planet Altair-IV has three lone inhabitants: Professor Morbius (Walter Pidgeon), a fugitive super-scientist who has created a world of futuristic marvels; his daughter Altaira (Ann Francis), a bewitching innocent who has lived her entire life on the planet: and their servant, Robby the Robot. Then Commander Adams (Leslie Nielsen) arrives, and what ensues is a spine-chilling adventure with a hint of romance. “Forbidden planet” became a cult classic.

results.title: Little women
results.brief_description: Louisa May Alcott’s popular novel is brought vividly to life in this second screen adaption of “Little Women.” The March sisters are Jo (June Allyson), Beth (Janet Leigh), Amy (a blonde Elizabeth Taylor) and Meg (child-star Margaret O’Brien). Their father has left for the Civil War, leaving the girls under the watchful eye of their mother (Mary Astor). Far removed from war and safe within their New England home, the “little women” are a closely-knit family and a picture of happiness. When Laurie (Peter Lawford), the grandson of a rich neighbor arrives, the orderly world of the March family is disrupted. The sisters are smitten by this handsome stranger and a story of romance, rivalry, love and loss ensues. As the high spirited and determined Jo, June Allyson gives one of the finest performances of her career, ably supported by the superb ensemble cast. The film is beautifully crafted and deservedly received an Academy Award nomination for its exceptional cinematography. Co-starring Rossano Brazzi as Professor Bhaer.

results.title: Horse feathers
results.brief_description: Groucho, Harpo, Chico and Zeppo star in this anarchic parody of college life. As the President of Huxley College, Groucho is busy keeping his eye on the students, as well as on the curves of vivacious college widow Thelma Todd. She is secretly trying to find the secret football codes to sell to rival college Darwin. “Horse Feathers” includes the riotious classroom war scene and the climatic football game finale where all the rules are broken!

results.title: The Pebble and the penguin
results.creator_credit: Colin Mawby, Russell Boland and Don Bluth Productions
results.brief_description: The Full Moon Ceremony, a real-life Adeli Penguin ritual requires that all bachelor penguins present a special pebble to their sweetheart. If she accepts, they are partners for life. Hubie, a shy penguin with a heart of gold, finds a perfect stone to present to his true love Marina. The evil Drake, another admirer casts a plot which sees Hubie expelled from the colony. Luckily as he is cast adrift into the wide world, he meets up with Rocko and together they begin the long journey back home. A life-long friendship develops and at last Hubie gets his girl.

results.title: Nicholas and Alexandra
results.creator_credit: Franklin J. Schaffner, Sam Spiegel, Horizon (GB), Horizon (US) and Columbia
results.brief_description: A dazzling cast, with Michael Jayston and Janet Suzman playing the lead roles of the ill-fated Czar Nicholas II, and the Czarina Alexandra. Born to be one of the world’s most powerful men, Nicholas ruled millions of people with an empire stretching over one-sixth of the globe. His belief in the Divine Right to rule, made him oblivious to the hardships endured by many of his subjects who were ready to embrace the powerful ideals proposed by Lenin and his followers. The Czarina, in a desperate bid to find a cure for their haemophiliac son, relies heavily on the seductive and mysterious “Mad Monk” Rasputin. Once Lenin and his Bolsheviks gain power, the Royal Family is doomed. “Nicholas and Alexandra” is filled with the pomp and pageantry of history’s great events.
